title: Rising attacks on Japanese in Shanghai
description: The Japanese consulate in Shanghai said Sept. 13 that a Japanese national suffered an eye injury after being splattered with noodles in a restaurant, with a few others beaten by Chinese protestors.
cleanContent: By Mei Jingya, Sina EnglishThe Japanese consulate in Shanghai said Sept. 13 that a Japanese national suffered an eye injury after being splattered with noodles in a restaurant, with a few others beaten by Chinese protestors.The consulate said it had received 6 reports on attacks targeting Japanese in the city. Some were thrown plastic bottles by locals.Anger on Japan results in rising sentiment-driven violence on Japanese expats living in Shanghai.																																																																								|  |
